body.description: Blockchain is an ever-growing ledger that keeps a permanent record of transactions that took place on the network in a secure and chronological order, and cannot be changed or tampered with. Blockchains are best known for their crucial role in cryptocurrency systems, such as Bitcoin for maintaining a secure and decentralized record of transactions.The difference between a typical database and a blockchain is how the data is structured.In blockchain data is stored in the form of blocks, hence the name is Blockchain.

Data is stored in chronological order. The first block is known as the Genesis block where the root information is stored. Second block will have transaction hash and previous block hash to link the details. Data in blockchain is immutable.
